newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Wednesday, issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and they are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.

Traders said trading volume continued to fall today, with a rough balance of supply and demand. The Shanghai Short-term Financing Centre, the market's largest member and a money broker run by the central bank, was the biggest lender, they said.

"State-run banks have had many short-term funds to lend out recently," said one trader. "But a bull run on the domestic A share markets in Shanghai and Shenzhen in the past few months has absorbed much of the funds."
Traders think the balance is unlikely to be broken in the short term and expect the rates to move in a narrow rate.
